bajsjojje -- if its the torrent file itself here on this page you are trying to download just right click it and save target as - if its the torrent you are trying to start downloading just open the bittorrent client you have (utorrent, etc) and use the open command from within the program itself to open the torrent file to start the download
why do people still download the cam after a screener is out?
well that's the question isn't it?

bajsjojje  ---- it also could be that you have a file association problem... in other words, at some point you told windows media player to open the .torrent file extension and it has remember that and will continue to do that by default until it is changed.... try right clicking on the torrent files and changing the properties to open with your bittorrent client.


and dont watch this -- i got it at first and couldnt do it ..  i am glad i waited for the good souls that got their hands on an actual dvd screener... the difference is day and night in terms of quality
